Entries.DialogueText: Oh! Is this for me? For... for my birthday?
*sniff*... Sorry.
I'm... just not used to such kindness...
... I love it, though. It's perfect. Thank you so much.
For my birthday? That's so kind of you! Let me unwrap it...
...What!?
...Oh, I see. It's a cruel joke.
Silly me, I should've known better...
For my birthday? That's so nice of you! It's a great gift.
Mmm... it's so fragrant. I'm going to love this.
Wow... this looks really old. I'll have to ask Gunther about it. Thank you!
Thank you! I'm almost finished with a book right now, but I'll read this one next!
I... I see... *sniff* ... W... We can just be friends, then.
Hi, . Maru told me the news... I'm happy for you two!
I... I don't know what to say. I'm so happy...
Suddenly, the world looks a lot more beautiful, don't you think?
I'm trying to finish this book, but I keep getting distracted thinking of you.
I never thought my life would be more exciting than a novel, but it sure feels that way right now!
...Please, leave me alone.
I can't bear to see you...
You really mean it? Thank you! ... it's such a relief to hear that.
I've been working so hard on this recipe, and I'm really proud of it.
Oh... Uh, sure.
Oh...I'm sorry.
Me too.
...sorry.
I see.
Thank you...
I just wish George wasn't so upset... I was only trying to help.
Oh... I guess you're right.
I'm sorry, Mr. Mullner. It was rude, what I did.
I guess you're right... why stress out about something you can't change?
You're right, we shouldn't ignore the reality of aging.
I guess the sooner we come to terms with our mortality, the more time we can spend really living in the here-and-now.
That's nice of you to say... I totally agree with you.
We should treat our elders with the same respect we hope to receive ourselves some day.
That's a horrible thing to say. Life is a precious thing to waste like that!
That's right...
Really? I thought you'd have noticed by now...
No!
...Oh, . I thought you did, but I wasn't sure.
...I'll always remember this night.
You look so beautiful tonight... I... *gasp*
Y...You don't?
Oh no?
Well, I guess that makes sense... you're busy with other things right now.
... Me too. I'm glad you feel that way.
Yes... the urge to care for something innocent and helpless. It makes sense that we'd feel that.
Oh, really?
I think you'd make a good parent.
hmm...
If everyone thought like that, humans would die out.
Oh...
That's kind of sad... but I guess I can understand your point.
Really?... Uh... Well, alright. I guess I'll see you later then.
Great!
Let me just call the children over.
I'm teaching the kids about art history this week.
It can be a little dry for the kids, so I'm having them learn by drawing a picture in the predominant style of each century.
It's really been a hit!
I've been teaching Jas and Vincent about Dwarvish Archaeology...
Jas is curious about the origins of the Dwarves... but Vincent is mainly interested in dwarvish weapons!
Vincent has been asking me about slugs for weeks... so I prepared a whole lesson on them. They're actually pretty interesting!
Whenever I see a banana slug, I feel like it's a sign of good luck.

', what do you think... should a person be judged by their actions, or by their intentions?_Actions_Hmm... but don't we all make mistakes sometimes?_Intentions_Mmhmm... But what if you intend to do good, yet your actions cause harm?_Both_That's true... I guess it doesn't have to be one or the other. It might depend on the situation, too.'
I was just wondering what you thought...
I've been reading a book about the ocean. It accounts for most of the area of the world, and yet we hardly know anything about it!
Oh, pardon this bandage on my hand...
I went over to Maru's the other day and she showed me a new gadget of hers. The darn thing charred my palm!
Fall is a sad time of year for me...
When I was a little girl, my father abandoned us because he said he felt 'trapped'. We haven't seen him since.
I'm sorry to make things uncomfortable for you... It's just that this time of year makes me think of it for some reason.
Anyway... How's the farming life going?
Hi... Um, are you doing okay?
It's kind of embarrassing to be the only family in town who lives in a trailer.
I wish I could live in a nice house, someday.
Hi .
Your farmhouse must be pretty easy to clean, huh?
! I was just thinking about the future...
Where do you picture yourself in ten years?
I have a few ideas for myself...
Mom doesn't take very good care of herself...
I worry about her.
Your farm looks really pretty right now.
Oh... with me? Yes, of course!
...Will you take the lead, though? I'm nervous...
I accept!
*whisper* Thanks for going through with the formalities, dear.
Oh... No, thanks.
If you dig in the dirt you can find some interesting things.
One time I found a really old piece of pottery. I brought it to Gunther and he said it was over a thousand years old.
Dishes, dishes, dishes. Ugh... If my mother wasn't always nursing a headache from her late nights at the saloon, maybe she could help around the house a little.
I shouldn't complain so much about chores... some people in the world are really struggling, and here I am complaining about doing dishes...
Are you alright? We're all wondering what's going on...
This strange weather is a good opportunity to get the kids interested in nature!
Oh... Hello! I'm Penny...
That was a beautiful wedding. I know Maru will make you very happy, she's a great person.
Congratulations, . Sam's a lot of fun, I'm sure you'll never have a dull moment!
Hi...
Oh, did you want something?
That's how I feel. I'm just going to focus on making the future better.
Maybe you're right. It's better to cope with reality.
But if I keep trying I think I can get her to change.|I guess it makes sense. There's not much I can do to change it, anyway.
*sigh*... My mother definitely has a problem with going to the saloon too much.But it's best not to dwell on bad things, right?Right. It's best to be positive!I think it's good to be realistic.
I'm eager to move out. It's such a burden to be worrying about Mom all the time.
I want her to be happy, but I can't stay here forever... you know?
What you did for my family is so generous. Thank you!
There are some truly wonderful people in the world...
This sand is so soft and fine. It feels great on my toes!
This island is so beautiful!
I had a great time.
I'm a little embarrassed wearing my bathing suit in public.
I hope no one's looking...
Somehow, the water here looks so different...
I can hardly believe this is the same ocean I've been gazing at my entire life.
The wind keeps making me lose my page, but it feels really great on the skin.
I'm reading a book about a sailor who washes up on a deserted island.
I wonder what I would do in that sort of a situation?
Hey honey, do you mind standing a little to the left?
Thanks, the sun was making it a little bit hard to read!
This is such a small town. You can't avoid meeting everyone.
I wonder what it's like to live in the city?

Joja#Things changed a lot after the JojaMart went up. It's been really bad for Pierre's shop. Mom loves JojaMart, though. The prices are cheap, so she can afford a lot more there than she ever could at Pierre's.|Mom's been complaining ever since JojaMart closed down. I think it's good for her, though. Maybe she'll drink less Joja Cola now.
You've left a permanent scar on my heart, . Still... I'm ready to speak to you again.

bus#I heard you were responsible for fixing the bus back up. Thank you.|My mother used to drive the bus to Calico Desert... but the bus stopped working a few years ago. Mayor says there's not enough money in the town coffers, or else he'd have it fixed.
Hi... Um, nice weather, isn't it?
cc#Thanks for fixing the community center back up. I guess you're kind of a town hero.|Hello, . It's nice to see you're doing well.
Hello. Ummm...
The mountains look nice today, don't they?
So... do you like to decorate your farm house?
It must be nice having your own place to decorate.
The weather's interesting today, don't you think?
Sorry...
I've been trying to keep our place clean, but it always gets messy again.
It's hard to run a household all by yourself.
We're very lucky to have a library in such a small town.
When you're lost in a book, it's easy to forget the realities of your life.
...Maybe that's why I like reading so much.
...Sorry. I got carried away there.
I wish I could keep a garden, but our yard is such a mess.
Maybe I'll live in a place where I can have a garden someday.
Maybe I'll live on a farm! *giggle*
I'm tutoring Vincent and Jas today... They're a handful, but it's nice to make a difference in someone's life.
Um, ? A farm seems like a good place for children, don't you think?
It was just a thought I had.

bus#Maybe now that my mother has her bus driving job back, I can start saving more money. Things are looking a little brighter.|I'm trying to save money from my tutoring job, but it's hard with my mother out of work.
We don't have a school here but I'm doing my best to give Vincent and Jas a proper education.
Every child deserves a chance to be successful.
Jas is very good at math and reading. Vincent is good at... well, he has an active imagination!
You know what? I should take the children on a field trip some time. Maybe to the forest.
A guest speaker would be nice... maybe someone familiar with nature?
Sorry, I'm just thinking out loud.
I've lived in Pelican Town my whole life. Can you believe that?
I guess there's a lot out there I'll never experience.
...yes?
Are you friends with Linus? He lives in a tent up in the mountains.
Everyone ignores him, the poor guy. He's actually really nice... Just a little odd.
It must be so cold to live in a tent this time of year.
On the 25th we'll be having the Feast of the Winter Star. It's one of my favorite events.
It's supposed to be a time to show gratitude for all the good things in your life... but for most people it's just a time to relax and exchange gifts.
Oh... hi. You want to talk?
If you find any interesting artifacts or minerals, Gunther will gladly display them in the museum.
He told me he has special gifts for people who donate.
I try to stay indoors as much as possible during the winter. I hate being cold.
I'm looking forward to seeing what your farm looks like in the spring.
It's going to be so fresh and beautiful.
.. I'm a little scared. This is such a big change!
Don't worry, I'm really happy, too.
We're going to have a little farm family, soon.
I'm so glad you feel this way about me.
There you are... I was worried you didn't get my note.
It looks like we're alone.
The water feels so good after being out in the cold of night, doesn't it?
-1 null -1 0 event_pool1 -1 0 event_pool2 -1 0 event_pool3#You wanted to see me in my bathing suit.
Um, how do I say this...
I've been meaning to tell you for a while now... about how I feel.
I can't stop thinking about you...
I've never felt this way about anyone.
-1 null -1 0 event_pool4 -1 -1500 event_pool5#Sorry, but I don't like you in that way...
... Good morning...
Notice anything unusually soft? I quilted this custom bedspread by hand.
So, what do you think?
Penny's been working very hard around the house...
It really feels like home!
I'm glad you like it. The house is starting to look really cozy, isn't it?
Oh.. okay.
I put the old furniture in a chest... feel free to change it back...
Welcome home, honey... How was your day?
I'm happy you're home.
Oh, you smell like the outdoors...
It's nice...
You know... I really appreciate the hard work you do for the family.
So it's important to me that when you come home, the house is nice and cozy, and everything's in order!
So I was thinking... I'd like to re-decorate the bedroom with some of my own hand-made decor!
But first, I have to ask you...
Oh! The pop-overs are ready.
Just business as usual, huh?
Well, I've got a zesty new recipe in the oven, so maybe things will get a little more exciting!
Oh, I'm sorry!
Well, you're back now... I'll do my best to make you feel better.
That's great! I'm glad you enjoy your work so much.
Ah... something soothing. Okay!
Just give me a few days, then.
I won't touch any of your chests, but it would be nice if you could move them out of the bedroom.
Something warm and inviting, huh? That works for me!
Heh... Okay. Whatever you like, honey.
Oh! Okay... I won't worry about it, then.
Make yourself comfortable, dear.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19
Entries.DialogueText: Oh, ! It's perfect timing that you showed up.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_1
Entries.DialogueText: I brought the children on a little field trip into the countryside.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_1_1
Entries.DialogueText: You know all about life in the country, right?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_10
Entries.DialogueText: Vincent! That's not an appropriate question! Behave yourself, or I'll have to take away all your star points for the day.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_2
Entries.DialogueText: -1 null -1 10 event_speaker_yes -1 0 event_speaker_yes -1 -1500 event_speaker_no#No... I can't stand kids.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_3
Entries.DialogueText: Jas! Vincent! May I have your attention please!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_4
Entries.DialogueText: I have a very special guest here to talk to you today... our very own local farmer, .

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_4_1
Entries.DialogueText: He has first-hand experience living in the countryside... so he knows all about the valley's 'natural resources'!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_4_2
Entries.DialogueText: She has first-hand experience living in the countryside... so she knows all about the valley's 'natural resources'!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_5
Entries.DialogueText: Can anyone tell me what a 'natural resource' is?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_6
Entries.DialogueText: Jas?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_7
Entries.DialogueText: Very good! That's worth two star points, Jas.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_8
Entries.DialogueText: Okay, now let's give our full attention.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_9
Entries.DialogueText: Yes, Vincent?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_implied
Entries.DialogueText: Country life is all about gathering from the wild.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Forest/181928/f Penny 2000/t 900 1600/w sunny/G !IS_PASSIVE_FESTIVAL_TODAY TroutDerby, !SEASON_DAY summer 17 summer 18 summer 19_implied_1
Entries.DialogueText: The water around here is teeming with fresh seafood.#You'll find no better lumber south of Grampleton.
Vincent! Behave yourself. ${Mr.
Ms.}$ makes ${his
Vincent! It's not good to gossip!
Vincent! You're scaring Jas. Let's not talk about monsters.
Well, that's probably enough for today. You two run along and play.
It's a lot of work to take care of these kids...
But I don't really mind. I enjoy seeing them learn... and hopefully I can help them grow up to be good people.

-1 null -1 0 event_speaker_kids1 -1 20 event_speaker_kids2 -1 20 event_speaker_kids3 -1 10 event_speaker_kids4 -1 -10 event_speaker_kids5 -1 -10 event_speaker_kids6#No, I don't want to be tied down with a family.
Well, I'm glad you showed up, . I think the kids had a great time.
Thanks for making my field trip a success today.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:HaleyHouse/195012/f Haley 2500/f Emily 2500/f Penny 2500/f Abigail 2500/f Leah 2500/f Maru 2500/o Abigail/o Penny/o Leah/o Emily/o Maru/o Haley/o Shane/o Harvey/o Sebastian/o Sam/o Elliott/o Alex/e 38/e 2123343/e 10/e 901756/e 54/e 15/k 195019
Entries.DialogueText: How could you do this to us, ?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:HaleyHouse/195012/f Haley 2500/f Emily 2500/f Penny 2500/f Abigail 2500/f Leah 2500/f Maru 2500/o Abigail/o Penny/o Leah/o Emily/o Maru/o Haley/o Shane/o Harvey/o Sebastian/o Sam/o Elliott/o Alex/e 38/e 2123343/e 10/e 901756/e 54/e 15/k 195019_1
Entries.DialogueText: ...yes.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:HaleyHouse/195019/f Haley 2500/f Emily 2500/f Penny 2500/f Abigail 2500/f Leah 2500/f Maru 2500/o Abigail/o Penny/o Leah/o Emily/o Maru/o Haley/o Shane/o Harvey/o Sebastian/o Sam/o Elliott/o Alex/e 38/e 2123343/e 10/e 901756/e 54/e 15/i 446/k 195012
Entries.DialogueText: Personally, I don't think there's anything fishy going on between them...
Hmmph! I don't know what's considered 'normal' in Zuzu City, but I'm definitely not okay with this arrangement!
Good answer, Leo!
Here, let me help you, Mr. Mullner!
There you go!
71 null 71 50 event_mail1 71 -50 event_mail2 friend_George_25 71 0 event_mail3#I'm just taking a walk, minding my own business.
That's okay, Mr. Mullner. I understand.
-1 null -1 0 event_old1 -1 0 event_old2 -1 0 event_old3 -1 0 event_old4#I'd rather die young...
Well, it was interesting talking to you, . I should go.
Thanks for doing this!
Robin, thank you so much...
Then... who?
Let me see...
Oh no... Your books are falling apart...
They're just too old.
...But new books are expensive, so we'll just have to make do with what we have...
Did you hear that, kids? You're getting brand new school books!
I don't know what to say... Thank you so much.
...to both of you!
New books!
... This is absolutely incredible...
I... I don't know what else to say...
Mom...
Don't worry... I understand why you get angry sometimes. Your life hasn't been so easy...
? What are you doing here?
... you didn't need to do this...
But, thank you. This means a lot to me.
Don't worry... just wants to make us happy. No one in Pelican Town looks down on us for being poor.
Don't worry, Mom... we just want to make you happy. No one in Pelican Town looks down on us for being poor.
Ughh... It's so dirty in here.
! Um... Sorry that it's such a mess. I was about to clean up.
You'll help me? You really mean it?
Okay, you can get started over there. I'll clean the kitchen.
Mom, the house is a total mess. and I were just trying to tidy things up a bit.
*sniff* *sniff*... Were you at the saloon just now? You smell like beer...
It IS my business! I don't want you destroying yourself!
Don't you realize your choices have an effect on me? Stop being so selfish!
...Yes, mother.
, you came at a good time!
I'm just about finished cooking a new recipe I invented!
Let me just finish up real quick.
Here, give that a little taste.
72 null 72 50 event_cook1 73 -50 event_cook2 73 0 event_cook3#Well it's definitely unique... how did you get it so rubbery?
72#Hey, since you're the first person to try it, I'm going to name this one 'Chili de '.|Well, I guess this recipe was a failure...
Um... so how about we watch a movie or something?
Thanks for being my taste-tester.
We have a beautiful home and a thriving family... it's all I've ever dreamed of, and more.
I hope we win the grange display contest!
I won the wheel of chance ten times in a row and now the man won't let me play anymore...
Come here, sit for a while! There's space on the bench for the both of us.
*phew* After being on my feet all day, it's nice to finally take a moment to relax.
Oh... These vapors... Hmmm... You look nice tonight.
The vapor from this cauldron... it's making my head spin, but I can't seem to leave...
*phew* I got lost in the maze...I was worried I might get trapped and everyone would go home without me!
I was in the maze for a while but then I got hungry.My Mom seems to be enjoying herself.
Maru's trying to convince me to eat a deviled egg. I'm just not sure I can stomach it...
The children have been looking forward to this festival for weeks.
Hopefully Vincent will be able to find an egg this year... It would be good for him to feel like he's a contender.
*gulp*... I'm nervous.
I could imagine us moving to a spot like this, someday.
Vincent asked me to dance with him. Isn't that cute?
I'm just humoring some old friends. What I really want is a bowl of that soup.

We do this festival every year to give the governor a taste of everything the valley has to offer.Mayor Lewis hopes it will get the governor on our good side. That's why he's so neurotic about the way the soup tastes.
I heard a rumor that the governor is considering buying a vacation home here.
Isn't it wonderful to see our community come together like this? I try my best to treasure these moments.
Life is so easy for a jellyfish... just letting the waves carry you onward forever.
I would've brought us a pot of tea if I had known it would be this chilly!
Brr... that's a chilly breeze. I should've worn a hat!
I'm thankful to have met you...
What a beautiful tree.
I hope everyone likes my powdermelon crisp...

'Hello, . What kind of gift are you hoping to receive this year?_An iridium milk pail_Oh? I've never heard of such a thing. It sounds expensive._An interesting book_Yes, a book can make a very nice gift!_A lump of coal_...I can't tell if you're joking, but that could be a useful gift!'
Are you entering the fishing contest this year, ? My mom's pretty serious about winning.

'Hmm... What kind of snowman should we make?_A classic one. Carrot nose, top-hat, scarf._I guess maybe it's best to stick with the classics, huh?_Something funky. Icicle antennas, pine cone eyes._Okay! That sounds like fun._Snowmen are boring. Think outside of the box!_Um, okay... I think I might stick with something more conventional.'
When we get home, let's make a fire and have some hot cocoa....with marshmallows?
I'm too nervous to walk on the frozen lake...I read a book once, where a girl fell through the ice.She was okay! But... I've been cautious about it ever since.
Thank you! I really love this!
Thank you! This looks special.
Uh, it's for me? ...Thanks.
Ugh...I'm sorry, but I absolutely hate this.
Thanks, this looks nice.
